speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me a little bit about what's been going on at school and at home that's been causing you trouble?"

speaker: Patient
text: "It's just that sometimes I don't want to do what my teacher says and my friends don't like it when I don't listen. I feel like they're trying to boss me around and it makes me really mad."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so you're saying there have been some issues at both school and home, but you're not really sure what's causing them or how they're connected. Can you tell me more about what's been going on at school, like what specifically has been bothering you or what's changed recently?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I guess it's just that sometimes I don't feel like I have a choice, you know? My teacher will tell me to do something and I'll do it, but then they'll tell me I have to do something else and I'll feel like I'm being forced to do it. It feels unfair."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it sounds like you're feeling a bit overwhelmed and unsure about what's going on. Can you tell me more about what's been bothering you at school, like are you getting along with your classmates, or is it something specific with your teachers?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't know, I guess I just don't like being told what to do all the time. My friends don't seem to mind, but my teacher does. They're always saying 'yes sir' or 'yes ma'am' and it makes me feel like I'm not in charge."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your behavior at school or at home, such as mood swings, irritability, or difficulty sleeping?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, yeah. Sometimes I just feel really angry for no reason, and it's hard to calm down. My mom says I'm not sleeping well at night, and I do get really tired in the morning."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about these changes you've noticed in your behavior? Do you feel like they're getting worse or better over time?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I don't know, I just feel like I'm getting really mixed up sometimes. One minute I'm fine, and the next I'm just super mad and can't calm down. My mom says I'm a good kid, but sometimes I don't feel like it."

speaker: Doctor
text: "I'd like to take a closer look at your behavior and overall well-being. Can you tell me about your daily routine, including what time you wake up, go to bed, and what you do during your free time?"

speaker: Patient
text: "It's pretty easy, I guess. I wake up at 7 am, and my mom makes me breakfast. I do my homework for a bit, and then I play video games or watch TV until lunchtime. After lunch, I usually go to the park with my friends or ride my bike. When I get home, my mom makes me dinner, and then I do more homework or play some more. I go to bed around 9 pm, I think."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it sounds like you're having a tough time with your daily routine and feeling overwhelmed. Can you tell me more about your daily routine and how you think it might be contributing to these issues?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I guess it's just that I don't really have a choice about what I do or when I do it. My mom makes me do things and I don't really get to decide. And sometimes I feel like I'm stuck in a routine and I just want to do something different, but I don't know what that is."

speaker: Doctor
text: "I'd like to take a closer look at your emotional state. Can you tell me how you're feeling right now, and if there's anything that's making you feel anxious or stressed?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I'm feeling really frustrated and stuck right now. I don't know what's going on or how to make it stop. It feels like I'm just going through the motions and I don't really get to be in charge of my own life."

speaker: Doctor
text: "I'd like to check your vital signs to see if there's anything that stands out. Can you please take a deep breath and relax while I check your pulse, blood pressure, and temperature?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I'll try. *takes deep breath* I feel a bit anxious just waiting for this, I don't know what you're going to find."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, let me just take a look at your vital signs... Your pulse is a bit higher than normal, your blood pressure is slightly elevated, and your temperature is a bit off. I'm going to request a test to run some blood work to see if there's anything else going on. Can you tell me more about your appetite and if you've noticed any changes in your energy levels?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I don't really feel like eating as much as I used to. Sometimes I'll eat a whole meal and then forget to eat lunch or dinner. And I don't know, my energy levels just seem really all over the place. One day I'll be fine, and the next I'll be so tired I just want to sleep all day."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about your appetite and if you've noticed any changes in your energy levels? Have you been feeling more hungry or full than usual?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I don't really feel like eating as much as I used to. Sometimes I'll eat a whole meal and then forget to eat lunch or dinner. My mom says I'm always hungry, but sometimes I don't want to eat anything. And my energy levels just seem really all over the place. One day I'll be fine, and the next I'll be so tired I just want to sleep all day."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about your appetite and if you've noticed any changes in your energy levels? Have you been feeling more hungry or full than usual?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I don't really feel like eating as much as I used to. Sometimes I'll eat a whole meal and then forget to eat lunch or dinner. And my energy levels just seem really all over the place. One day I'll be fine, and the next I'll be so tired I just want to sleep all day."

speaker: Doctor
text: "I'd like to check your reflexes to see if there's anything else that might be going on. Can you please lift your right hand up for me?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Yeah, okay. *lifts right hand up* I'm not really sure why, though. I mean, I've done this before at school, but it doesn't really feel like anything's wrong."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Great job lifting your hand, now can you please point to your right thumb and then to your right index finger for me?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I'll do that. *points to right thumb and then to right index finger* I don't see why I have to do this, though. It feels like you're just trying to figure out if something's wrong with me."

speaker: Doctor
text:
"Excellent, now I'm going to check your reflexes again. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your reflexes, like if they're slower or faster than usual?



Also, I'd like to request a test to check your thyroid function, REQUEST TEST: Thyroid Function Test. This will help me understand if there's an issue with your endocrine system that might be contributing to your symptoms."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for telling me more about your appetite and energy levels. I'd like to check your reflexes again, specifically the patellar reflex. Can you please bend your knee and tap your right kneecap with a reflex hammer for me?"

speaker: Patient
text:
"Okay, I'll try. *bends knee and taps right kneecap with reflex hammer* Yeah, I guess it feels a bit funny when you hit it that hard, but I don't really know what's wrong with it."

"I'd like to do another reflex test, specifically the ankle reflex. Can you please lift your foot up for me?"

speaker: Doctor
text: "Great, now that we've checked your reflexes, I'd like to ask you a few more questions about your sleep patterns. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your sleep quality, such as insomnia, nightmares, or excessive daytime sleepiness?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I don't really sleep well at night. My mom says I'm always waking up during the night, and I don't feel rested in the morning. Sometimes I'll fall asleep okay, but then I'll wake up and just feel really groggy and tired."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about your sleep patterns, like what time you usually go to bed and wake up, and if you have any trouble falling asleep or staying asleep?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I don't really know what time I go to bed and wake up. My mom usually wakes me up in the morning and makes me get ready for school. But sometimes I'll sleep in later than usual, and sometimes I'll stay up really late playing video games or watching TV. I don't really feel like I'm getting enough sleep, though."

speaker: Doctor
text:
"Can you tell me more about your sleep patterns, like what time you usually go to bed and wake up, and if you have any trouble falling asleep or staying asleep?"


"Okay, so it sounds like you're having trouble falling asleep and staying asleep. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your sleep environment, such as a new bed, a noisy room, or a family member who's sleeping in the same room as you?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, no, I don't think so. My mom's been using the same bed and room for as long as I can remember, and I don't think it's been noisy or anything. But sometimes I'll lie awake at night and just think about stuff, and I'll be up for hours like that. My mom says it's because I'm not tired enough, but I don't think that's it. I feel tired, but I just can't seem to fall asleep."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, thank you for sharing all this information with me. Based on what you've told me, I'm going to request a test to check for sleep disorders, REQUEST TEST: Sleep Study. I'd also like to request a test to check for thyroid function again, REQUEST TEST: Thyroid Function Test. I want to make sure we rule out any potential thyroid issues that could be contributing to your symptoms. Can you tell me if you have any family members with thyroid problems or sleep disorders?"
